alert.note: Alert for Logan; Macon; Moultrie; Piatt; Shelby (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 02 at 9:53AM CDT until August 02 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SOUTHEASTERN LOGAN, CENTRAL MACON, NORTHWESTERN MOULTRIE, SOUTHWESTERN PIATT AND NORTH CENTRAL SHELBY COUNTIES... At 950 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing and multiple underpasses have been reported as being flooded out in Decatur. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Decatur, Mount Zion, Forsyth, Mount Pulaski, Bethany, Long Creek, Warrensburg, Lovington, Dalton City, Latham, Chestnut, Decatur Airport, Hervey City and Lake City. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
